replies.body:
> I had a toxic team last game

How your teammates act has no bearing to your behavior.

> I tried to carry the game for team

How well you do has no bearing to your behavior.

> I had 0 curse words on my team chat, I only showed frustration. I kept saying 'fragile mentality' to Irelia 

Curse words do not make or break toxicity. You can be toxic to someone *without* swears, as evidenced by your very chat logs. Harassing, insulting, and berating other players are **all** toxic, and will be handled accordingly.

> yet I got a 14 day suspension.

Yes. Because that was the next step up on the punishment escalation. You had 2 chat restrictions before this ban, both of which warned you that continued behavior of a similar kind would cause you to be banned (and as a warning, your reform card for this ban will have told you that *any* instance of validated toxicity following your 14 day ban will cause a permanent suspension).

> Do you have to be a good Catholic boy to play this game to not get punished?

You don't have to be perfect. You just have to be a decent person. Don't insult your teammates. It's literally that simple.

> You can't even show your frustration anymore?

If that's what it takes for you to not harass other players, then that's the action to take.

You can be frustrated, even outright angry --- just keep it out of the game if you can't be nice.


___

Riot has, especially in the past year, cracked down on people who are "fake afk" to avoid afk detection when they don't want to play. AFKjungling, maliciously split pushing, and other similar behavior are all punished as trolling with an instant 14 day ban.

This chat log is not "worthy" of a 14 day ban on it's own. It is your accounts history of multiple warnings that you ignored that led to the escalation. Riot isn't going to just keep giving you a chat restriction when it's clearly not fixing your behavior.

Keep in mind that further misbehavior in chat, no matter how "minor", will result in a permanent ban on your account.
